Key Arguments: The bill threatens freedom of speech and democracy in Australia.
Individuals should be responsible for researching and determining the truth of information themselves.
Government intervention in labeling information as misinformation or disinformation is problematic.
Historical instances exist where information initially labeled as misinformation later proved true.
The bill is perceived as a move away from democracy towards a more controlled society.
Notable Quotes: It is my view that this bill poses the utmost threat to freedom of speech and democracy in Australia.
